intro: Hieracium medium, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish in color. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium medium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes and seeds.
